item.title: Platform Engineer
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Data Platforms team is the hub of analytics at TELUS.  So much so that our future forward solution is known as Data Hub.  Our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the ability to put data into motion through batch and real-time processes to bring data from on-premise systems to cloud platforms. Our cloud presence allows TELUS teams to make use of cloud native functionality to drive reporting and developing machine learning models.  The sky\'s the limit.

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution. Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.

 

Here\'s How

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal data flow and drive process and architecture changes to make it happen by collaborating with their owners
  • Design and implement solutions to move data across systems and locations
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Take solutions from concept to production by using 3rd party tools, writing code, config, and scripts
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them #DSEjobs

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • You are kind and want to make things better for others in collaboration with others
  • You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform
  • You have experience with the flow of data between systems 
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have used cloud platforms such as Google Cloud for application hosting
  • You have experience with YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You are able to provision infrastructure and secure & reliable services and applications in the cloud
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use cases
  • You have experience supporting and maintaining production environments
  • You have good understanding of DevOps & DataOps principles and tools
  • You don’t deploy to production on Fridays

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Hands-on familiarity with at least one of: Kafka, Google Pub/Sub, NiFi
  • Experience with Google’s BigQuery service
  • Understanding of DevOps, DataOps principles and tools
  • Data Warehousing design experience
  • Familiarity with monitoring, alerts, and logging solution

item.title: Senior Data Engineer
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


 
The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

 

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Build data pipelines, provision infrastructure and secure reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP
  • Analyze data, build models and generate reports and visualization using Hadoop and Cloud infrastructure
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modelling
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementating and performance tuning Spark
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technolgy, data processing systemsgies (MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra, HBase, Redis, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark or others)
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • You are experienced with Apache, its ecosystem and relevant tools (Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, Avro)
  • You are familiar SQL-on-technologies (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

 

Nice-to-haves

 

  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • DevOps practices and tools experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience

 

#DSEjobs

item.title: Manager-Technology Strategy - Wireless Core Network and Services DevOps
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

TELUS’ Wireless Core Network & Services Dev/Ops team is responsible architecture, deployment, optimization, and operations for technology platforms that support the national wireless core network. We have a unique opportunity for an engaging people leader to manage a software development team.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You will lead a team of engineers and software developers to transform to virtualized network functions, softwarize network services, and improve service reliability across core platforms. The team will work with our industry partners, both telco vendors and hyperscalers, to develop and operate wireless services including but not limited to system integration, software development, data analytics and automation. Your management skills, industry knowledge and technological leadership will shape TELUS’ next-generation networks and services.  Moreover, your natural abilities to collaborate with other teams such as Product and Sales will set you apart.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Coach, develop and inspire a diverse team of DevOps professionals
  • Solve problems and handle escalation in a collaborative and effective manner 
  • Set key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure individual and team successes
  • Build trust and partnership with internal/external stakeholders and lead customers
  • Develop and operate software solutions based on virtualized infrastructure and 5G 
  • Focus on reliability across critical user journeys
  • Using Agile engineering principles, you will lead the efforts to quickly adapt to new technologies, services and applications
  • With a constant focus on customer experience and industry trends, you will lead on-going improvements to our core to ensure the best customer experience every time, everywhere
  • Manage platform lifecycles, 3-year service roadmap and Capex/Opex budgets
  • Adopt principals of Reliability by Design, Security by Design and Privacy by Design

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Respected as a collaborative partner and trusted advisor who builds strong relationships across the organization and providing value add
  • Regarded as an excellent communicator, negotiator and influencer, able to communicate complex ideas and concepts to a variety of audiences including senior leaders in a clear, simple, easy to understand manner
  • Recognized for your Customer First mindset and delivering on optimal outcomes for both internal and external stakeholders
  • Sought out for your strategic thinking, business acumen, sound decision making and result-driven mindset with the ability to take initiative and ownership of complex issues through to resolution
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of:
    • Application integration models and methodologies
    • Agile development and DevOps methodologies
    • Application Development environments and technologies for delivering digital solutions
    • Software development and coding techniques 
    • Cloud native technologies and concepts
  • Proven business, financial and strategic skills with experience in assessing alternatives and business case development
  • Noted to have a high degree of curiosity, continuously learning new topics, concepts and technologies, and also looking beyond the surface level to understand the full picture and questioning/challenge the status-quo resulting to drive higher business value
  • Respected for your advanced knowledge of 3GPP (IMS/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) wireless core networks optimization and performance
  • Ability to interact with technical team members and distill complex ambiguous problems into actionable items
  • Experience negotiating with vendors for new technology and support agreements
  • Broad base of knowledge across IT and Network systems, support and processes
  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and/or relevant experience

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Big data correlation and machine learning knowledge
  • Experience in web/mobile applications development
  • Master of Engineering degree and/or MBA

item.title: Cloud RAN Data Scientist
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The latest Open RAN (Radio Access Network) technology brings not only BBU (baseband unit) couldifications & virtualization, open interfaces between DU (Distributed Unit) and RU(Radio Unit) , but also introduces and enables ORAN intelligent automation platform namely SMO (Service Management and Orchestration) with RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) which applies automation at scale to simplify the complexity of ORAN networks, as well as improve network performance, enhance customer experience and minimize ORAN operational costs with ORAN analytics and assurance. 

 

Introducing TELUS’ new Cloud RAN automation platform DevOps team which will oversee the development, operations and evolution of ORAN SMO and RIC. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth. We see great value in bringing Cloud, IP/MPLS, data analytics and software development professionals into this team in addition to RAN knowledge to not only develop these platforms but also enhance the systems. 

 

As a Data Scientist working closely with various stakeholders including TELUS’ Chief Technology Office, ORAN DevOps team, and external vendors, you play a critical role in enabling ORAN intelligent operations by developing automation policies and algorithms, workflow and data processing services.

 

What you’ll do

  • Lead the development of ORAN data processing workflow, as well as data pipelines system design and configurations to ensure ORAN data availability and integrity to end users
  • Responsible for ORAN SMO (service management and orchestration) platform design and technology development, drive vendor’s SMO roadmap to align with TELUS’s ORAN automation strategies
  • Responsible for ORAN RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) platform design and technology development
  • Create ORAN automation policies & rules, templates & algorithms and workflow services for ORAN full stack automation, including server Bare Metal, xHaul, CaaS, and vDU/vCU services. 
  • Develop ORAN-Cloud orchestration and federation solutions including ORAN IMS (Infrastructure Management Services) and DMS (Deployment management Services)
  • Responsible for ORAN Software and Hardware Life Cycle Management solution development and introduction
  • Define TELUS RIC model and algorithm standards for new xApp and rApp onboarding
  • Lead the integration with TELUS overarching remedy’s and systems
  • Lead platform system issue troubleshooting and integration 
  • Drive Open SMO integration with TELUS’s selected vRAN solutions
  • Technology introduction of evolutionary ORAN OAM (FCAPS) via streaming telemetry
  • Lead SMO/RIC platform AI (Artificial Intelligent)/ML (Machine Learning) workflow services design and technology introduction

Qualifications


What you bring

  • Working experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) technology and Telco OSS system
  • Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in Underlying infrastructure for Big Data Solutions (Clustered/Distributed Computing, Storage, Data Center Networking) 
  • Expertise in NiFi setup and administration 
  • Expertise in design, development, and configuration of data processing and ETL workflow
  • Expertise in design and development using Spark, Spark Streaming, Kafka, etc.
  • Familiarity with the telecommunication industry wireless access DevOps workflows of design, plan, deployment, change management and operations. 
  • Understanding of the various phases of the Software Development Life Cycle and familiarity using Source Code and Version Control systems 
  • Expertise in one or more programming languages and data formats such as Java, Python, GO, XML, YAML, Shell Scripting, JSON, RESTful APIs etc. 
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform.
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Experience on Kubernetes cloud analytics tools (such as Beats, Logstash, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Kafka and/or Prometheus)
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

  • 5G RAN cell site deployment automation development experiences, including workflow engine, inventory databases
  • Familiarity with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi or hybrid cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Big Query, DataFlow etc.
  • Experience with AI/ML toolkits such as Tensor flow, Mllib, H2Oai, Kubeflow etc
  • Working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes networking technologies such as VxLAN, Calico, CNI, M-Lag, EVPN etc.

 

ORANJobs *LI-remote *LI-hybrid

item.title: People Analytics Consultant - People & Culture
item.description:
Description

 

Help business leaders make strategic decisions.

 

Join our team

 

People Analytics (PA) is a small team with big scope. We are collaborative, enthusiastic problem solvers delivering better people and business outcomes through data that is business informed, business relevant, usable, and actionable. PA is responsible for enabling HR and Business leaders with insights to make evidence-based decisions which support the creation and execution of People and Business strategies. The team needs an individual who is creative, technical, curious, and passionate about using data to drive business results. This is a fast paced, highly rewarding role that makes an impact at TELUS through the ability to change the way we look at people data.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Senior People Analytics Consultant will use consulting and analytical skills to deliver people analytics and insights to TELUS’ Business Leaders and HR to drive people strategy and strategic workforce decisions. The job will be a combination of solving strategic problems and servicing day-to-day data requests (80/20 split).

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Gain strong understanding of TELUS’ business and people goals and use analytical skills to make data-driven workforce strategy recommendations to support business objectives
  • Consult with HR and Business leaders to scope client needs, understand the root of the client’s challenge, and translate them to questions that can be approached through analytics
  • Perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, and uncover trends and relationships
  • Communicate results of analysis to stakeholders at all levels using reports and engaging presentations. Help tell stories with data and make recommendations by interpreting the “so what” and “now what” from analysis
  • Identify, prioritize and implement improved data quality and additional data capture opportunities to enhance analytical capabilities
  • Assist in building analytical acumen among team members in the People & Culture organization

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • High business and analytical acumen with excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to influence and partner with stakeholders
  • Strong understanding of the HR function and data or a demonstrated ability to quickly acquire functional expertise
  • Ability to draw conclusions using data in order to answer business questions and clearly communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders
  • Comfortable working with large sets of data with ability to merge and analyze data from disparate sources
  • General knowledge of statistical and data analysis tools and methods to conduct or direct analytical work appropriately
  • Advanced Excel skills (lookups, complex array formulas, data modeling, formatting, data visualization)
  • Advanced PowerPoint skills including experience creating compelling presentations that blend data with insights
  • Project orientation and ability to balance multiple projects and priorities
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity while being highly adaptable and flexible to changing demands
  • Learning orientation and desire to stay ahead of the latest developments in the field of HR reporting, analytics and related technology

 

Great-to-haves

 

Preference will be given to candidates with some combination of the following:

 

  • 3+ years of experience working in a consultative capacity using people data to generate critical insights for leaders and decision makers
  • Background in strategy/HR consulting or in I/O psychology
  • Proficiency with SQL, statistical software packages (e.g., R, Python, SAS, SPSS), and data visualization tools
  • Knowledge of various machine learning techniques and key parameters that affect their performance
  • Experience in designing and implementing A/B Testing, measuring and improving processes to enhance Employee experience
  • Experience conducting analysis and creating storyboards in Visier

 

Education

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Business, Finance, Math, HR, Social Sciences, or related field or equivalent experience
  • Language – Bilingual English/French an asset

item.title: Senior Privacy Manager, Digital Health
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data & Trust Office’s Health Privacy team at TELUS provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to teams across the organization in advancing our commitment to digital health technologies, which demonstrate respect for our customers and their privacy through transparent, robust, and ethical practices. Our team takes pride in earning a reputation for being innovative thought-leaders, strategic business partners and subject-matter experts in privacy and data governance. We’re looking for someone who radiates this passion and is eager for the opportunity to transform healthcare delivery in Canada. 

 

We’re looking for a privacy professional who is passionate about developing solutions that will change the way in which patient care is delivered while simultaneously protecting the privacy of patient data. Our ideal candidate will have prior operational and advisory experience working on privacy issues relevant to healthcare.
 
You will be an integral member of the Health Privacy team acting as the Privacy Officer for TELUS Health Virtual Care. Your primary responsibility will be to manage the day to day privacy program for the TELUS Health Virtual Care team where you will support both clinical and business operations to ensure that TELUS Health Virtual Care not only complies with Canadian and global privacy laws and regulations, but implements best practices and innovative privacy solutions to earn the trust of our customers. You should feel comfortable working with a wide variety of stakeholders as you will work closely with product, engineering, legal, security, and sales teams. You should also feel comfortable in representing us in front of clients and regulators. 

 

At TELUS, you will push boundaries and be a champion for privacy in the healthcare sector. You will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all our decisions around data, privacy, and innovation.
 

Succeeding at TELUS requires strong communication, collaboration, and creative thinking skills paired with a sense of humour. You will need to be comfortable with working through complex issues where there aren’t always clear answers, and able to work with many different types of personalities and earn their trust. You will need to handle complicated compliance issues while maintaining our team-spirited workplace.

 

.

Here’s how:
 

  • Advise on privacy and data issues as it relates to healthcare, virtual care, health technology, AI, and machine learning
  • Conduct Privacy Impact Assessments, identify risks and provide corresponding recommendations
  • Support the development of a privacy and data program that meets or exceeds the expectations of our customers while simultaneously ensuring TELUS’ ability to respectfully leverage data to deliver value to our stakeholders
  • Serve as a subject matter expert assisting in commercial negotiations with clients, vendors, and partners
  • Help respond to inquiries from privacy regulators and other government authorities
  • Manage and respond to privacy incidents
  • Perform due diligence on new acquisitions and support post-acquisitions initiatives, including PIAs, building privacy programs and developing policy frameworks
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure adherence to the TELUS’ Trust Model
  • Document, prioritize, and communicate clear privacy requirements for product initiatives and releases
  • Add value and support business units to deploy or leverage technology ethically, including AI, by providing expert advice to execute on TELUS’ data handling frameworks
  • Educate and advise the business team on new data, privacy, and ethical uses, and provide strategies to address privacy and data governance considerations
  • Assist in designing and documenting processes that standardize best practices and support an agile development methodology
  • Evaluate and report on the performance of the program using established success metrics
  • Monitor privacy trends in the internal and external environment and advise on impact to TELUS Health’s information and privacy practices
  • Learn continuously, innovate every day and seek opportunities to develop and demonstrate thought-leadership

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • Has 3+ years of experience in applying privacy laws, including familiarity with provincial health information legislation 
  • Effective in communicating data risks in written form and verbally communicating progress on initiatives in leadership forums
  • Believes in the importance of proper program planning, and flawless execution and delivery
  • Demonstrated track record of defining and delivering measurable outcomes for the business in a highly complex stakeholder environment
  • Is a compelling communicator, persuasive storyteller and a big thinker: strategic, critical and creative 
  • Ability to protect the TELUS brand and act with a sense of urgency to efficiently assess material impacts and effectively mitigate risks
  • Recognized for your excellent interpersonal skills to build and foster relationships across all levels of the organization
  • Sought after for your ability to develop creative solutions where challenges are presented
  • Highly adaptable, and comfortable working in a demanding and fast-paced environment
  • With Post-secondary education
  • IAPP certified (or willing to become certified within 6 months)


Great-to-haves

 

  • French/English bilingual capabilities are a highly valued asset for this role
  • Previous experience working in the healthcare sector is an asset
  • Legal background/experience is an asset
  • Project management experience is an asset

item.title: Performance Analysis Consultant, Customer 360 Operations
item.description:
Description

 

Join our Team

 

We are the Business Intelligence team, an integral part of the TELUS Business Marketing organization. We are a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and engaged team driven to rapidly respond and adapt to the changing needs of Canadian business customers including Small, Medium and Large businesses. We as an organization stand with owners, and are passionate in enabling our business customers with state of the art technology and solutions as they focus on what they are best at. We are the destination of choice for transformation enthusiasts who enjoy challenging the status quo and enable a data-driven marketing organization.

item.title: Senior Market Manager - Journeys & Omnichannel - Koodo
item.description:
Are you passionate about big data and using data science to make better business decisions? Leveraging digital personalization to drive better customer outcomes? Managing strategic projects that focus on core business priorities?


 
Join us!


 
At Koodo, we believe you can eat ice cream in the winter, drink coffee after 4PM, and serve white wine with beef. Because at Koodo we don\'t follow the rules, we make the rules. We\'re small, agile, entrepreneurial, refreshing, challenging and fun. We promise you won\'t find a more exciting place to work. So, join our team of super ninjas and ninjettes and see for yourself why Koodo has been voted the best place to work for 83 years running, by people who work at Koodo.


 
Our team and what we’ll accomplish together


 
As a Senior Market Manager at Koodo, you will be responsible for (i) integrating data science models across all team activities while innovating on new ones, (ii) creating personalized use cases for customers on our Koodo website, (iii) and leading other strategic projects. While primarily sitting in the Churn & Renewal team, all of Koodo Base Management will be your playground, as you help the team reduce churn, manage cost of retention (COR), and drive increased customer step-up revenue. 


 
This role is incredibly cross functional! You will constantly work with the Data Science team to collaborate on models and triggers creation, as well as to innovate on the future of marketing at Koodo. You will liaise with the Koodo and TELUS digital teams to map out customer journeys, as well as manage and prioritize products. You will collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure you are driving the right strategic and financial outcomes. You will wear many hats – some days reviewing model outputs with a data scientist and other days collaborating with your marketing peers to develop the creative strategy for our customer-facing communications – no day is the same, but all days are rewarding!
 

 

What you’ll do
 
 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Digital, Data Science, Call Centre, Store Channels, Marketing Communications, etc.) to develop and maintain the strategy and roadmap for your portfolio, while helping them innovate on theirs
  • Use business analytics and intelligence tools to pull and synthesize insights to create and drive change that improves the conversion rate of Koodo marketing campaigns
  • Use a test and learn approach to continue to improve & evolve Koodo marketing activities
  • Enable technologies that help Koodo become more automated, personalized, contextual, innovative, and anticipatory in the delivery of marketing activities
  • Identify and prioritize key opportunities within the customer journey and path to purchase
  • Provide updates on program goals / outcomes to key business team members and executives, including: business cases, post mortem analyses and building slides / presentations to support your storytelling
  • Act as a key idea generator for journeys and sales conversion at Koodo by maintaining an in-depth understanding on how journeys, new technology and data can have an impact on business priorities and metrics

 

 

What you bring 
 


You are an out of the box thinker who can come up with new and innovative customer journey opportunities, but you are also analytically driven to ensure we are focusing on the right areas. You are a self-starter who moves fast and is eager to learn. You love working with other people, and collaborating to make big business change!
 

  • You have experience leading and developing cross channel marketing campaigns
  • With superior analytical skills, you can organize information and draw insights from data
  • Known for your excellent project management work, having managed and delivered complex projects involving people, process, technology, and change
  • With exceptional communication and collaboration skills, you build solid relationships with stakeholders, and work with teams to consistently deliver on results
  • No challenge is too hard for you – you are willing to roll up your sleeves and work through ambiguous problems and new paths never taken before
  • You are interested in digital technology and how that can change the way businesses engage with their customers
  • 4-6 years of equivalent experience

 

 
Great-to-haves

 

 
Don’t have everything we think are ‘great-to-haves’ below? Don’t let that dissuade you! Attitude, motivation, and a willingness to collaborate are the most important things we are looking for. So if you think you have what it takes, regardless of a fancy university degree or not, please apply!
 

  • University or college degree in Marketing, Business Administration: Honors Business Administration (HBA), Commerce, Master of Business Administration (MBA), Economics, or Engineering
  • 3+ years working experience in Marketing or similar business function.
  • Experience with marketing personalization and personalization enabling technologies (e.g. Adobe Experience Cloud)

item.title: Senior Front End Developer - API Marketplace Portal
item.description:
Join our team


Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading-edge technologies. We hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s Top 100 Employer (2022) with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, and award-winning opportunities for career development.
 
The API Marketplace gives the ability to connect API consumers with API owners, enabling the creation of thousands of applications by TELUS teams and 3rd parties. Being able to support a broad range of applications from customer self-care to health to messaging to emergency response to fleet management to charitable giving and beyond, the API Marketplace plays a foundational role for TELUS to participate in the digital economy.

 
What you\'ll do
 

As a Senior React Developer, you will help drive the software development for our core network infrastructure and services. Your creativity coupled with strong software development, automation, data science, and computer networking skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building and maintaining our API gateway platform to a variety of types of services from network capabilities to health services to support existing mobility infrastructure and offer new services.
 
You will exercise your entrepreneurial spirit and creative vision to change the way TELUS leverages technology. Collectively, the passion we have to transform the Network landscape will remain a leading factor in why customers continue to recognize TELUS as the fastest and most reliable network in Canada.

 
Here’s how
 

  • Create new solutions while working as part of our existing Agile Development Team with a good focus on quality, automated testing and reliability
  • Develop quality solutions through adherence to coding standards and test automation.
  • Develop new features and implement design improvements 
  • Participate in creation of technical design documentation: Detail design & architecture documents
  • Participate in operational improvement initiatives, in conjunction with other technology teams in the company

What you bring

 

  • With a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Valued for your 5+ years of relevant professional experience as a Senior React Developer with demonstrated experience guiding a team 
  • Skilled in software development/software engineering, process automation using programming/scripting languages
  • Working in collaborative agile development teams, with experience working with CI/CD pipelines and activities.
  • Known for your experience working on cloud computing platforms including AWS & GCP
  • Passionate about API design
  • Committed to building strong relationships with key stakeholders including senior management across the technology and partnering organizations


Great-to-haves
 

  • Java Experience
  • DevOps tools such as Ansible, Jenkins, GitLAB and Splunk


Note:  Can work remotely from any major Canadian city

Join Our Team

item.title: Senior Design Specialist - 5G Capacity and Data Analytics
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Join a team that is in the heart of the telecommunications revolution. Help us transform our network capacity planning processes to enter the 5G era.

 

Our team is responsible for the capacity planning of TELUS’ wireless network, this includes a broad range of data analytics and engineering activities, from projects that guide multi-year executive strategies to day-to-day network capacity planning to support the growing network traffic. You will have the opportunity not only to master new technologies, but also apply modern engineering best practices, including automation and ML/AI, to build and evolve the Best Wireless Network.

 

As a 5G Capacity and Data Analytics Specialist, you’ll provide technical leadership to ensure we efficiently plan and deploy network capacity based on customer specific requirements. The role is an intersection between Network Performance, Business Requirements and Customer Experience.

 

Your creativity coupled with strong data analytics skills and RF Engineering will allow us to find the best ways of building our wireless 4G/5G networks to support existing and new services. Finally, together as a team, we will help shape the future vision of TELUS’ wireless network by providing important guidance to executives on how best to address our evolving business challenges.

What you’ll do

 

  • By using modern data analytics and automation techniques, transform our capacity planning processes to enter the 5G service based era
  • By proactively defining novel capacity planning techniques/models for 5G/LTE use cases
  • By producing and managing the RAN network capacity plans for mobility and fixed wireless users
  • By collaborating with other technical and business teams to understand new technologies and services to make our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
  • By developing dashboards and data visualizations, you will provide insights into network capacity that can be shared with executives and peer groups
  • By monitoring network performance, you will identify actual capacity problems and predict future congestion issues in the network
  • By leading the implementation of wireless capacity augments, you will build working processes with performance and construction teams to drive improvements in customer experience

 

What you bring

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in computer science, computer engineering or engineering
  • 7+ years of experience in mobile capacity planning and radio network design or optimization, and expertise in 5G and LTE technologies
  • Three to five years of experience in data analysis or software development
  • Proven ability to operate independently from general guidelines
  • Ability to refine (locally) or expand (nationally) analyzes based on a specific problem Ability to problem solve and make intuitive decisions using large data sets
  • Passion for data science, forecasting and using data visualization platforms like Splunk
  • Experience with SQL databases, understanding of NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, Splunk)
  • Python experience and basic knowledge of common data analysis libraries

 

Great to haves

 

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Experience with agile methodology and cloud services, preferably Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in deploying Node.js application, microservices or distributed systems

item.title: Product Specialist, Product, Innovation & Enablement - Digital Channel Analytics
item.description:
Description

 

The Exclusive Partner Program (EPP) team works hand-in-hand with corporate organizations across Canada to provide their employees with value added services. This Mobility Marketing team is dynamic, driven, fast-paced, and highly engaged. Together, we are responsible for using a 4P approach to delivering profitable growth through one of the fastest growing segments of the TELUS mobility business. 

 

TELUS is a great place to work. You can see it in our team members. The diversity of the TELUS team and their unique contributions set us apart from the competition. Our success is based as much on our future friendly team as the innovative internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer.

 

Here’s what we will accomplish together:  #Li- remote 

 

This dynamic Product Specialist role on the EPP Product Innovation & Enablement team is responsible for supporting end-to-end internal omni-channel forecasting, performance tracking and optimization. As the EPP category grows and our channel strategy evolves to support it, you will grow to become our team’s trusted advisor by establishing a deep understanding of our digital-first channels. You will have the opportunity to build and leverage models and processes to support channel insights and prioritization. You will blend data, insights and storytelling expertise to inform the efficacy of integrated omni-channel programs, while also identifying opportunities to drive digital attribution and adoption metrics. In collaboration with various cross-functional partners across the service continuum, including Digital, Channel, Finance, Client Experience, etc., you will create structure around the planning and performance cycles that inform the decision-making and direction of key omni-channel initiatives. 

 

Here’s how:

 

  • Ownership of digital attribution across wireless EPP:
    • Forecasting on attributable volume and tracking (digital-start)
    • Target rationalization & planning (mitigation & stretch)
    • Manual SIM/Digital Commerce order tracking 
    • Data insights and reporting for lead management programs
    • CE inbound/frontline data integration (Tableau)
    • Digital Performance ownership: Dashboard creation and management (DOMO, New Relic, Adobe, etc.), Maintaining analytics dashboards & reporting views, self-serve reporting 
  • Funnel conversion analytics (submission tracking, drop-offs, etc.) through proprietary digital tools
  • Owning data-driven quickwins workstreams for continuous digital journey improvements
  • Use effective critical thinking and storytelling to explain digital attribution drivers and trending
  • Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders across TELUS Digital, Client Experience/Frontline, Marketing, Sales and Channel teams to solidify how we look at our digital mix for the category 

 

 

Qualifications

 

Here’s what YOU bring to this role:

 

  • Critical thinker - able to apply structured and analytical problem solving techniques to tackle unexpected challenges and opportunities
  • Strategic thinker - you have strong business and financial acumen and are able to analyze business cases, understand the business implications of decisions and provide guidance to stakeholders
  • Data guru - beyond having proficiency with MS Excel, you are curious and keen to work with other powerful DBMS and BI tools like Adobe Analytics, SFDC, Tableau, DOMO, and Google Cloud
  • Data-driven decision maker - identify gaps and use analytics to distill insights that allow you to make thoughtful, fulsome recommendations
  • Project manager - experience bringing complex solutions to market, while making the case for intelligent trade-offs between delivery time / quality / scope and cost
  • Communicator - develop clear, concise and compelling narratives

 

Great-to-haves:

 

  • Experience working with DBMS and BI tools such as DOMO, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, SFDC, Google Cloud, etc.
  • Educational background in Business, Economics, Data Science, or other related fields
  • Proven track record of driving a culture of high engagement and performance
  • B2B, B2B2C, telecommunications and/or technology-based industry experience is an asset

 

What WE Give Back to YOU:

 

  • Opportunity to show your stuff and be recognized and rewarded for excelling
  • Highly-engaged, dynamic and collaborative environment
  • Opportunities for personal development through training, networking and career development
  • An organization that actively supports you giving back to the community you live in
  • Competitive compensation and benefits
  • Place that embraces our core values: spirited Teamwork, courage to Innovate, embrace Change and initiate Opportunity, and a passion for Growth

item.title: Reporting Analyst, National Business Sales Reporting
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team 


We are currently seeking a motivated individual that is able to combine his/her strong technical background and business acumen to help us create a critical link between data analysis and business intelligence. 


Our team is known within TELUS as a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and a great place to learn and develop. We have a culture of collaboration, recognition, and high-performance. Simply put, if you\'re bright, ambitious and eager for a challenge, this is the place to be.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


With your help we will provide advanced analytics, insights and unbiased recommendations to enable our stakeholders and leadership teams to make informed business decisions.


Here\'s how

 

  • Help propel our business forward by creating meaningful understanding of business drivers, issues, and opportunities while enjoying a high degree of autonomy 
  • Take the initiative to constantly and consistently apply your analytical and relationship skills to support TBS
  • Support data-driven decision-making by enabling actionable insights from disparate data sources and implementing key innovation opportunities for stakeholders
  • Implement best-in-class end-to-end analytical processes to drive operational efficiencies and improved decision-making
  • Have the opportunity to showcase your ability to transform data into true business insight
  • Mentor, coach and provide expert technical guidance to develop junior team members


#LI-REMOTE

Qualifications

 

  • Advanced background in SQL, Python, Tableau or Domo with 3+ years of working experience
  • Proven ability to breakdown and simplify complex, ambiguous problems
  • Understanding of telecom business models, measures and metrics
  • Best in class data presentation skills 
  • Naturally curious with a strong ability to work through obstacles
  • Embodies ownership, initiative and is self-directed; able to effectively manage ambiguity and change
  • Highly skilled in stakeholder communication and management, building relationships to establish cross functional alignment for projects and initiatives
  • Expert storytelling in presenting to diverse audiences while tailoring your message to drive business outcomes
  • Ability to provide structured recommendations based off of analytics
  • Ability to manage projects from infancy to completion 


Great-to-haves

 

  • University degree and/or 5-6 years of equivalent combination of experience and education
  • Fundamental understanding of Data Science techniques and its strategic impact to business
  • Project management designation

item.title: Junior Graphic Designer
item.description:
Available Locations
Vancouver

What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic candidate to fill our Junior Graphic Designer position on a year-long contract. With the opportunity to work cross-functionally with team members across all our offices and functions, this role will support all visual design needs for Borealis AI. As a member of the Operations team, you will be joining a group that believes in being Bold & Curious, so we are looking for someone who is creative, eager to learn and looking to make an impact! 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Collaborating with our Senior Visual Designer to provide cross-functional design support on all visual design needs;
  • Supporting operations, marketing, partnership, and product teams with creative ideation;
  • Designing and preparing artwork for print and digital applications;
  • Designing PowerPoints and Word Documents;

  • Typesetting;
  • Formatting files;
  • Attention to detail;
  • Maintaining a well-organized artwork filling system;

You\'re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • Experience in an internship or entry-level graphic design role;

  • Experience in Microsoft PowerPoint and Word;
  • Ability to work efficiently and accurately with minimal supervision;

  • Ability to multitask and prioritize workload to meet deadlines;

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. item.title: Machine Learning Researcher
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

As a Machine Learning Researcher, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. We\'re a lab that supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects. Working in our lab will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to build game-changing statistical models.

 

Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A passion for solving open problems using data and algorithms;
  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications and/or sophisticated AI product experience;
  • Ability to formulate and drive a research project independently without close supervision;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.

What’s in it for you?

item.description:

Capital markets are known for their complex dynamics and intricate dependencies. As a Machine Learning Researcher in our capital markets team, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. Our team supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects, including game-changing studies on dynamic interactions between statistical models operating on a common source of data.

 

Working in capital markets will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to drive your vision. Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AISTATS and more.

  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;

  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications;
  • A passion for solving open problems in areas such as time-series analysis, generative modelling, graph-based architectures, or multi-agent systems;

item.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
item.description:
Available Locations
Toronto

What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic software developer who’s excited by the opportunity of being at the forefront of machine learning technology, and working on extremely challenging problems. As a Machine Learning Software Engineer, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end – everything from literature review and data pre-processing to implementing machine learning algorithms and front-end development.

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Building machine learning-based software solutions for solving important problems;
  • Prototyping solutions to evaluate the impact of selected algorithms on the target problem;
  • Collaborating with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions;
  • Optimizing algorithms and prototypical solutions for efficient implementation;
  • Extending prototypes into fully functional, polished solutions ready for internal and/or external use;
  • Supporting projects with thorough documentation of usage, design decisions and capabilities;
  • Extracting, transforming and loading massive datasets using distributed computing framework technologies (Hadoop, Spark, etc.);

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent.  A master’s or PhD in an AI sub-field is an asset;
  • 2+ years of software development experience (including co-op and internships) in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment;
  • Experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in one of the major languages such as C++, C#, Java, Python 3.x;
  • Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting;
  • Experience with Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow, Theano, Keras and PyTorch is an asset;
  • Exposure to distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases;
  • Demonstrated experience in two or more of the following areas: Traditional Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Time-Series Analysis, Computer Vision, Reinforcement Learning;
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including testing methods, coding standards, code reviews and source control management.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;

item.title: Research Engineer
item.description:
Borealis AI is a team of researchers and developers dedicated to solving today’s leading problems in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Our researchers are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of theoretical and applied science, while our development team transforms state-of-the-art technologies and algorithms into impactful products with the potential to reach millions of people.


We’re looking for an enthusiastic scientists or software developer who’s excited by the opportunity of being at the forefront of applying machine learning technology to challenging problems. As a Research Engineer, you’ll be part of a collaborative team delivering AI projects end to end – everything from data pre-processing and exploration, to prototyping novel algorithmic solutions, to software implementations of machine learning-based products. You will function as a bridge between research and development teams to help extend research prototypes into implemented products.


At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision.


Your responsibilities include:

  • Building machine learning-based software solutions;

  • Collaborating with researchers to prototype machine-learning solutions rapidly;

  • Conducting comparisons to existing algorithms and baselines;

  • Reviewing, extending, and optimizing prototype solutions;

  • Collaborating with the engineering team to integrate algorithms into products;

  • Developing reusable internal tools to facilitate research prototyping; and

  • Supporting projects with thorough documentation, design decisions, and capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A master’s or PhD degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, economics or equivalent
  • 2+ years of applied machine learning experience in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment;
  • Experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in one of the major languages such as Python 3.x, C++, or Julia;
  • Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting;
  • Experience in the following areas: deep learning, time series, monte carlo simulations, PDEs, derivative pricing;
  • Experience with deep learning packages such as PyTorch, Keras, and Tensorflow;
  • Exposure to distributed computing using CPUs and GPUs;
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including testing methods, coding standards, code reviews, and source control management; and
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.

What’s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;

Montreal

We’re looking for a Senior Engineering Manager to lead our Montreal engineering team, working at the forefront of machine learning technology and working on extremely challenging problems. 

 

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineering Lead, you will manage a team of managers and engineers involved in multiple ML projects.  You will support those projects through the entire lifecycle—from research experimentation through to implementing applications and solutions and deploying them to production.  You will provide your team with technical leadership, mentorship and guidance. You will work along other senior managers in engineering and across Borealis AI to help achieve our strategic goals. As a people manager you will be responsible for growing your team and fostering their career development and growth.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Provide strategic direction, leadership and management to a team of managers and engineers involved in multiple ML projects
  • Provide functional management to multiple ML projects
  • Establish high standards and share technical knowledge in performance, scalability, system architecture, and engineering best practices; 
  • Establish and maintain collaboration with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions; 
  • Grow and develop the team, helping each team member advance their career development.
  • Work with Borealis senior leadership to achieve the Borealis mission and strategy
  • Drive cross-team cohesion and help to build the culture of the Montreal office

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • Have 12+ years of experience delivering software projects to production; 
  • Have 7+ years experience managing engineering teams; 
  • Experience working collaboratively with business, product and other technical teams; 
  • Have led the full lifecycle of software product development including the successful deployment of products to production; 
  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software products, fostering career growth of software engineers, and establishing software engineering best practices within your team; 
  • Experience working in an agile environment, including managing team members across multiple different projects and/or products
  • Experience managing hybrid teams; promote an excellent employee experience regardless of where employees are
  • Have a background in machine learning or a related field; 
  • Experience with financial services and enterprise software. 

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential; 
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable; 
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities; 
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale. 

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Senior Product Manager
item.description:
Available Locations
Toronto

What\'s the opportunity?

As a Senior Product Manager on the Product team, you’ll get a chance to lead the development of a state-of-the-art AI product for the financial services industry. You and the cross-functional project team will be responsible for discovering, building and delivering a product that solves a high-impact business problem. You will also be responsible for defining the long-term product strategy, roadmap, and objectives to lead your team towards a product vision that supports both Borealis AI’s and RBC strategic directions.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading machine learning researchers and software developers. Our mission is to think big and go beyond what’s possible today to deliver competitive advantage to RBC through AI product development. This is a rare opportunity to build the skills required to make machine learning work in the enterprise.

 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Leading the development and delivery of machine learning products within Personal and Commercial Banking;
  • Defining and executing on both short and long-term product strategy and roadmaps;
  • Defining and delivering POCs and scaling them into full-fledged products;
  • Optimizing products to rapidly improve and scale across the bank
  • Leading and coaching a small team of product managers
  • Building and maintaining relationships with senior stakeholders within RBC.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • You have 7+ years of experience working in a product role;
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are a strong leader with the ability to own a product end-to-end independently, with a track record of successful product deliveries;
  • You are well versed in the core areas of applied machine learning and have experience with machine learning platforms and deploying models at scale;
  • You have managed, mentored, and/or coached product managers in past roles;
  • You are an experienced team leader who can guide a cross-functional team to successful delivery;
  • You are a strong collaborator and have the ability to influence both technical and business stakeholders;
  • You have experience working in banking, financial services, or fintech;
  • You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Opportunity to play a vital role in the development of leading-edge products;
  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and management opportunities;

item.title: Technical Recruiter
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity? 

Borealis AI’s mission is to be a leader in AI for financial services and world-class talent is at the heart of this vision.  We are looking for an experienced Technical Recruiter to support our recruitment objectives, including creatively sourcing, managing the candidate lifecycle, and closing candidates.

 

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to gain experience in a cutting-edge industry of AI/ML, who wants to be part of an innovative organization. You will have the opportunity to partner with hiring managers across our labs, working together
to find the best talent to support us in achieving our goals. Our team believes in being Bold & Curious, so we are looking for someone who is creative, eager to learn and looking to make an impact!

Your responsibilities include:

  • Partnering with business leaders and hiring managers to assess their talent requirements and advising on the best hiring strategy; 
  • Using a variety of techniques to discover and attract the best passive talent; 
  • Conducting interviews and phone screens to assess both technical baseline, as well as skills to be successful in the Borealis AI environment; 
  • Focusing on providing a great candidate experience at every opportunity; 
  • Constantly evaluating our processes and pipeline to ensure we are fairly evaluating candidates;   
  • Ensure the ATS (Greenhouse) and recruitment reporting is regularly updated to aid with metrics i.e. sources, agency against direct, time to hire, time to offer, average cost per hire, etc; 
  • Drive specific D&I activity/initiatives for recruiting by upskilling hiring managers on best practice and ensuring data is tracked successfully.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Minimum of 2+ years of technical recruiting experience; 
  • Demonstrated track record of excellence in sourcing and assessing technical talent; 
  • Proven relationship management experience with hiring teams and internal stakeholders, helping them navigate the sources of talent, and assisting them with assessment; 
  • Skilled in offer negotiation, awareness of pertinent employment legislation, and employment market trends; 
  • The ability to lead requisitions to successful conclusion – balancing efficiency with quality; 
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills; 
  • A genuine interest in the technology industry as shown by continuous learning throughout your career; 
  • Experience in a start-up, fast-paced environment;   
  • Experience with engineering, research and product roles would be a benefit. 

What’s in it for you? 

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential; 
  • Freedom to take initiative; 
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities; 
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale. 

About Borealis

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto,Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.  

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment 

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors.
